info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:10PM CDT until July 21 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL TIPPAH...NORTHERN TISHOMINGO...NORTHERN ALCORN... HENDERSON...EASTERN HARDEMAN...MCNAIRY...HARDIN...MADISON...CHESTER AND DECATUR COUNTIES... At 309 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bemis to near Selmer to near Theo, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Corinth, Lexington, Savannah, Henderson, Selmer, Pickwick Landing State Park, J P Coleman State Park, Chickasaw State Park, Chickasaw State Forest, Big Hill Pond State Park, Parsons, Adamsville, Decaturville, Sardis, Silerton, Pickwick Dam, Masseyville, Reagan and Theo. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across McNairy County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Memphis. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
